I've tried explaining to a few people that they can unsubscribe via the mailchimp newsletter footer, but that is not going over to well.

Seems like a simple concept that works in other platforms than wp which I use, but can't seem to get a handle on with gravity.

results.title: Campaign Monitor Unsubscribe Exit Survey with Gravity Forms
results.description: I do like the Easy Unsubscribe functionality of Campaign Monitor from a usability point of view, however I also want to gain an insight into why the subscriber hits the unsubscribe link. So here is an example set up using Gravity Forms rather than Wufoo as suggested here: www.campaignmonit...
extra_snippets: I do like the Easy Unsubscribe functionality of Campaign Monitor from a usability point of view, however I also want to gain an insight into why the subscriber hits the unsubscribe link. So here is an example set up using Gravity Forms rather than Wufoo as suggested here: www.campaignmonitor.com/blog · Firstly create your Gravity Form exit survey.

I’m upfront on my survey informing the person that they have been unsubscribed now could you tell me why? Need to go the other way? If you need to add a user to your subscriber list then Gravity Forms already has an add-on for that: Gravity Forms Campaign Monitor Add-On ... So I’m trying to implement this on my site, and in campaign monitor, it has this bit about adding a form to your site, and it wants you to copy and past HTML code onto your page. Does that mean subscribers are not removed from your list until they fill in their email and confirm, or does the unsubscribe button within the email ITSELF unsubscribe the person who clicked it (before they ever get to your page)?

Next, insert your Gravity Form exit survey into a page and give it a nice URL such as ‘newsletter-unsubscribe’ · Moving over to Campaign Monitor now and get to the ‘Unsubscribe settings’. Under the heading ‘Redirect unsubscribers to your own confirmation page’ enter your new URL and the dynamic form fill ie www.YOURDOMAIN.COM /newsletter-unsubscribe/?user=[email] One issue is that the unsubscriber does not need to complete your survey as Campaign Monitor has already unsubscribed them before redirecting them to your way.

However the user does not know this and normally completes the survey. I’m upfront on my survey informing the person that they have been unsubscribed now could you tell me why? Need to go the other way? If you need to add a user to your subscriber list then Gravity Forms already has an add-on for that: Gravity Forms Campaign Monitor Add-On

results.title: Managing Square Subscriptions in Gravity Forms
results.description: Canceling a subscription can only be done from the Gravity Forms entry record. Square does not currently provide an interface for canceling subscriptions. Thus if an entry is permanently deleted, there will be no way to cancel the associated subscription.

meta_url.path: › home  › managing square subscriptions in gravity forms

extra_snippets: Canceling a subscription can only be done from the Gravity Forms entry record. Square does not currently provide an interface for canceling subscriptions. Thus if an entry is permanently deleted, there will be no way to cancel the associated subscription.

If the subscription is active, a button that will allow you to Cancel Subscription will also be available. Canceling a subscription can only be done from the Gravity Forms entry record. Square does not currently provide an interface for canceling subscriptions.

results.title: Canceling (and Restarting) Gravity Forms License Auto-Renewals
results.description: ❗Warning: An expired license cannot be renewed or upgraded. To cancel renewals on the subscription attached to your license, do the following: Log in to your Gravity Forms account page, select the license you would like to manage, and then click Manage Subscription.

meta_url.path: › home  › canceling (and restarting) gravity forms license auto-renewals

extra_snippets: If a subscription is canceled, licenses contained in that subscription will still be valid for downloads and support until the listed expiration date. On the expiration date, you will cease to be able to download any of the related products, and you will no longer receive access to Gravity Forms Support.

On the expiration date, you will cease to be able to download any of the related products, and you will no longer receive access to Gravity Forms Support. If you would like to continue using Gravity Forms after your license expires, you will need to purchase a new license and change any existing sites to the new license key.

If you would like to continue using Gravity Forms after your license expires, you will need to purchase a new license and change any existing sites to the new license key. ❗Warning: An expired license cannot be renewed or upgraded. To cancel renewals on the subscription attached to your license, do the following: Log in to your Gravity Forms account page, select the license you would like to manage, and then click Manage Subscription.

You can restart renewals on a canceled subscription if you change your mind before the license expiry date. Go to your License list and looking for the “Restart Your subscription” option. If available, it will be shown in the notice box below your license key.

results.title: Cancel a Stripe Subscription in Gravity Forms
results.description: The Stripe API doesn't allow you to set the total number of recurrences of a payment or an end date when creating the subscription but it is possible to cancel the subscription via the gform_post_add_subscription_payment hook which runs after a payment is recorded.

meta_url.path: › home  › cancel a stripe subscription after a specified number of payments

extra_snippets: Because it runs for all forms with a subscription feed we need to tell it only to run for the correct feed, we do this by specifying the feed names in the array on this line: $feed_names = array( 'feed name one', 'feed name two' ); You would then update the following line with the number of payments you want to allow: ... If the count retrieved from the database query matches the value you specify the cancel method will be called which will notify Stripe that the subscription for that customer should be canceled.

The Stripe API doesn’t allow you to set the total number of recurrences of a payment when creating the subscription but it is possible to cancel the subscription via the gform_post_add_subscription_payment hook which runs after a payment is recorded.

If the count retrieved from the database query matches the value you specify the cancel method will be called which will notify Stripe that the subscription for that customer should be canceled. Stripe will then notify your site when that action has been completed and the status on the entry will update to canceled and a note will be added indicating the date it was canceled.
See also the PHP section in this article: Where Do I Put This Code?

results.title: Easily Manage Gravity Forms Stripe Subscriptions - GravityRanger
results.description: Easily Manage Gravity Forms Stripe Subscriptions with this third party add-on you've probably never heard of!

meta_url.path: › home  › easily manage gravity forms stripe subscriptions

extra_snippets: This page may contain affiliate links. Please read my disclaimer for more information. ... The official Gravity Forms Stripe add-on does not (currently) support managing subscriptions, upgrades or downgrades, and customer data like credit cards. If you use Gravity Forms and Stripe, you will have to do all of that from within the Stripe account, which means your customers can not manage their own subscriptions either.

If you use Gravity Forms and Stripe, you will have to do all of that from within the Stripe account, which means your customers can not manage their own subscriptions either. The good news, I recently came across a third party add-on that works with the official Stripe Add-On to give you and your customers the ability to manage subscriptions and customer details from your website. This is the complete feature set included in the Gravity Stripe Pro add-on, as of this writing:

From an agency standpoint, I like that they have added a “white-label” feature to hide sensitive account information like emails, license key, billing info, etc so that you can use your Unlimited site license on your clients sites. The UI feels a bit clunky and the design feels a bit half-assed. Although I appreciate that the plugin uses the Gravity Forms Add-on Framework so that most of the configuration is done with an individual form feed, I think having some global settings in this case would be appropriate.

Especially when I break down the numbers. For example, at $37/yr, if I’m selling a subscription that cost $59, I’ve paid for this add-on with one sale. And if the add-on makes it easier to upsell my customer to the next level and increase my revenue. I’ve spent a good amount of time playing with this Gravity Forms Stripe add-on and overall I’m impressed and looking forward to using this on a couple of our sites.

results.title: Stripe Extension - Cancel Subscription Step - Gravity Flow
results.description: The Cancel Subscription step will cancel a subscription that was started during form submission. Cancel Subscription Step Settings Subscription ID Field: Select

meta_url.path: › gravity flow  › extensions  › stripe extension - cancel subscription step

extra_snippets: For example, you could select a notification step and send emails to an administrator informing them that the subscription was not cancelled successfully. The Gravity Flow Stripe Extension adds two new settings to the Gravity Forms Stripe Add-On Feed Settings.

The Gravity Flow Stripe Extension adds two new settings to the Gravity Forms Stripe Add-On Feed Settings. Recurring Times: Set the number of times the subscription should repeat. Cancellation: Select when to cancel the subscription. The available options are "cancel immediately" which will cancel the subscription at the time the feed runs and "Cancel at the end of the billing period".

Subscription ID Field: Select the field containing the ID of the subscription that will be cancelled. Select "Entry Subscription ID" to cancel the subscription created for the current entry. If you'd like to cancel a subscription created in a different entry then select the field which will contain the ID of the subscription you want to cancel.

Select "Entry Subscription ID" to cancel the subscription created for the current entry. If you'd like to cancel a subscription created in a different entry then select the field which will contain the ID of the subscription you want to cancel. The dropdown will show all Hidden fields, Text fields and Subscription ID fields that are on the form.

results.title: How to Unsubscribe from Emails with Clean Email
results.description: Learn how to unsubscribe from emails in a few clicks and declutter your mailbox with Clean Email inbox email cleaner.

items.question: What does unsubscribing mean?
items.answer: The term “unsubscribing” means you are canceling a subscription to an electronic newsletter or email sender. Many of us end up on mailing lists we never actually needed or wanted, and unsubscribing from these unwanted messages can help clean up your inbox so you can stay productive.

items.question: How do I email unsubscribe from unwanted emails?
items.answer: You can unsubscribe from emails that land in your inbox in several ways. You can select “unsubscribe” at the bottom of those messages, use your mail provider’s built-in unsubscribe tools, or take advantage of Clean Email’s Unsubscriber feature.

items.question: How do I unsubscribe if there is no unsubscribe button?
items.answer: If there’s no unsubscribe button at the bottom of the message, you can look for the unsubscribe or block option within your email provider’s settings. items.title: How to Unsubscribe from Emails with Clean Email

items.question: How do you protect your email inbox from getting spammed?
items.answer: Marking emails as spam helps both you and your mail provider flag suspicious senders. Anything that looks outside of the ordinary or asks you for personal information is likely a scam. An email unsubscribe app can make this process easier. Learn more about how to stop spam emails.

Want to unsubscribe from mail in a big batch? Several services make it possible. The downside is that you have to give these services complete access to your inbox in order for them to find messages with an unsubscribe option, and sometimes that includes access to your contacts or even your calendar.

The downside is that you have to give these services complete access to your inbox in order for them to find messages with an unsubscribe option, and sometimes that includes access to your contacts or even your calendar. Like Heinlein said: there's no such thing as a free lunch.

results.title: How do I cancel my subscription? - Gravity Flow
results.description: Licenses are renewed automatically until cancelled by the customer. Subscriptions can be cancelled very easily from the account area on https://gravityflow.io/a

meta_url.path: › gravity flow  › gravity flow support  › how do i cancel my subscription?

extra_snippets: Licenses are renewed automatically until cancelled by the customer. Subscriptions can be cancelled very easily from the account area on https://gravityflow.io/account. Log in using the account details you created when you purchased. Click on the Subscriptions link, find the subscription you want to cancel and click cancel.

Subscriptions can be cancelled very easily from the account area on https://gravityflow.io/account. Log in using the account details you created when you purchased. Click on the Subscriptions link, find the subscription you want to cancel and click cancel.  · If you want to cancel a subscription, please ensure that you remove the plugin from your system because outdated plugins are a security risk. IMPORTANT: Please note that we cannot grant refunds for renewal payments so if you don't intend to renew be sure to cancel your subscription BEFORE the renewal.
